Iâ€™m working on a presentation for a workshop I'm working on in Berlin, I would like your help in crafting a prompt to send to a graphic designer to help me design a series of around 20 slides to describe and enthuse an audience around our one day Color Analysis workshop. The audience is in Berlin, they have a tech background and may not have the appropriate knowledge for selecting the colours that work well with their skin tone. The company's name is  Remerge and the day will begin with our 20 slide presentation and then individual colour sessions for the rest of the day.
The presentation will include some information on the history, colour analysis process, and benefits to overall wellbeing, confidence, unused articles of clothing clogging closets and landfills. Our goal is to excite the team members for their sessions by going over the history beginning with the Johannas Itten from the Bauhaus movement in Germany, and  demonstrating appropriate and inappropriate colour choices chosen by icons online, including the queen, Olivia Coleman, and Julia Roberts (who surprisingly always wears the wrong colour. As well as concluding with takeaways including methods for culling a wardrobe and being generally ecological and awesome.


Here is my first slide presentation flow:
Welcome to Color Analysis
Visual: Company logo and a vibrant, inviting image related to color (e.g., a color wheel).
Description: Brief welcome and overview of the workshop.
History of Color Analysis
Visual: Portrait of Johannes Itten and images from the Bauhaus movement.
Description: Overview of the origins and evolution of color theory.
International Color Theories
Visual: Artwork or symbols representing Sufi color symbolism, a diagram of chakras with their corresponding colors, an illustration of the five elements with associated colors, and traditional Yoruba art showcasing color use.
Description: Highlight key international color theories (Sufi, Indian, Chinese, African).
Celebrity Color Examples
Visual: Photos of Keira Knightley, Julia Roberts, and the Queen in different outfits.
Description: Show how celebrities use color to enhance their image with visual examples.
Choosing the Right Colors
Visual: Side-by-side comparisons of the celebrities wearing suitable and unsuitable colors.
Description: Illustrate the impact of wearing appropriate versus inappropriate colors.
Benefits of Color Analysis
Visual: Infographic or icons showing increased confidence, wellbeing, and wardrobe efficiency.
Description: Discuss how color analysis can boost confidence, wellbeing, and wardrobe efficiency.
Wellbeing and Productivity
Visual: Visual showing how different colors can affect mood and productivity.
Description: Summarize findings on how color affects mood, stress levels, and productivity.
Ecological Benefits
Visual: Visual showing a cluttered wardrobe versus a curated, eco-friendly one.
Description: Discuss how mindful wardrobe choices can reduce environmental impact.
The Color Analysis Process
Visual: Photos or illustrations of the drape and swatch method used by Melissa.
Description: Explain the drape and swatch method used in color analysis.
Transform Your Life with Color
Visual: Motivational quote related to personal transformation through color.
Description: Summarize key points and end with an inspirational quote.
Questions & Answers
Visual: Simple, clean slide encouraging questions.
Description: Open the floor for audience questions and provide answers.
thanks. It's ok, although I'd like to frame the entire presentation around the three impact areas
1. personal wellbeing and financial wellbeing. 
2. positive business impacts (productivity) and wellbeing at work.
3. environmental impacts (reduction in landfill waste, consume better) 
think step by step about how to reorganise the slides with these themes. I'd like to mention it at the start, tell them I the middle and remind them at the end. 
Come up with 3 alternative thematic flows to express this goal and present it in a markdown table
